DOC.HEAD: Cuomo Names Task Force On Defense Spending
DOC.TEXT: Gov. Mario Cuomo has named a task force to help New York companies learn to make butter instead of guns. Cuomo created the task force Thursday to help New York companies that lose defense contracts ``make a successful transition into commercial production.'' Noting that ``defense spending is a $20 billion industry in New York state,'' Cuomo said the state had to be ready for change, given Defense Secretary Richard Cheney's plan to cut military spending. Cheney is considering cuts in the armed forces and cancellation of weapons programs as part of an effort to reduce the defense budget. Last month, Cheney directed the services to come up with from $140 billion to $180 billion in cuts from the fiscal 1992 to 1994 military budgets. Cuomo said the task force would be headed by Vincent Tese, the state's economic development director, and Brad Johnson, the governor's Washington lobbyist. At the same time, the Democratic governor warned that the nation must maintain its ability to produce weapons. ``If events in the Soviet Union or in Eastern Europe were to take a dramatically different turn, we must be able to respond,'' he said. ``I am concerned about the erosion of our industrial base in this country at a time when the Pentagon is awarding $10 billion in contracts to overseas bidders.''
